DOC.brief_title: THE EFFECTIVENESS AND SAFETY OF LIVIAÂ® TRANSCUTANEOUS ELECTRICAL NERVE STIMULATION ( TENS ) IN WOMEN SUFFERING FROM DYSMENORRHEA
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , control , multi-center , single-arm , crossover , double-blind clinical study assess Livia Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) woman suffer dysmenorrhea . The study conduct community clinic . Advertisement use publish promote recruitment . The study include 3 visit : Screening visit two consecutive visit one monthly menstrual period . Treatment self-administrated study , subject request complete home diary .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Women age 18 45 year 2 . Women report painful menstruation last 3 menstrual cycle . 3 . Pain VAS score least 60 base previous menstrual cycle 4 . Subject willing able comply study protocol provide write informed consent participate study . 5 . Subject must agree consistently use effective contraception throughout study 1 . Participation investigational study within 30 day prior and/or date subject consent . 2 . Woman significant medical condition : cancer , diabetes ( Type I II ) , irritable bowel disease IBD , immunodeficiency , autoimmune disease , etc . investigator opinion , participation study would place patient unacceptable risk . 3 . Pregnant woman 4 . A woman diagnose secondary dysmenorrhea associate uterine myoma , endometriosis , adenomyosis , etc . 5 . A woman cardiac condition cardiac pacemaker , implanted defibrillator , implant metallic electronic device .
